results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the power of 2 in denominator of coefficients of Legendre polynomials, where n >= 0 and 0 <= k <= n.
example: Triangle T(n,k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k >= 0) begins as follows:
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := IntegerExponent[Denominator[Coefficient[LegendreP[2n, x], x, 2k]], 2]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 28 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = if( k<0 || k>n, 0, -valuation( polcoeff( pollegendre(2*n), 2*k), 2))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 25 2002
